bibl.title: The Death of Demotic at Philae, A Study in Pilgrimage and Politics.
bibl.note: The transformation of Philae into a Christian sanctuary sounded the death knell of the Demotic stage of the Egyptian language. The latest known Demotic inscriptions were written in the fifth century A.D.

bibl.title: A Tribute to Excellence. Studies Offered in Honor of Erno Gaál, Ulrich Luft, László Török

bibl.seg: CRUZ-URIBE Eugene, The Death of Demotic at Philae, A Study in Pilgrimage and Politics.
Tamás A. BÁCS (Ed.), A Tribute to Excellence. Studies Offered in Honor of Erno Gaál, Ulrich Luft, László Török = Studia Aegyptiaca. 17 (Budapest, 2002) pp. 163-184.

The transformation of Philae into a Christian sanctuary sounded the death knell of the Demotic stage of the Egyptian language. The latest known Demotic inscriptions were written in the fifth century A.D.
